oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Centennial celebrations; Exhibition buildings; Exhibitions; Anniversaries; Events; Fairs; Commemorations; Columns
Tennessee Centennial and International Exposition (1897 : Nashville, Tenn.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An exterior view of the Children's Building at the Tennessee Centennial Exposition, which was located beside the Gourd Arbor. The building was a two-story structure with Rococo style architecture.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Calvert Bros. & Taylor
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Everything of interest to children was housed in the Children's Building. Throughout the Exposition a kindergarten class was held as well as a series of entertainments for children.
